value.name: 'Tories sinking feeling as 58 MPs announce plans to abandon Conservative ship'
value.description: Some 58 Tory MPs have already announced they are quitting next time around but the figure could top 100 – by some counts even 150

value.name: Oil and gas giants in crisis talks over Labour's windfall tax
value.description: Oil and gas bosses will attend crisis talks this week over Labour's plan to extend the windfall tax. Industry group Offshore Energies UK (OEUK) said Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer's policy would be a 'hammer blow'. It had previously warned it could cost ...

value.name: Woman arrested on suspicion of murder after three children found dead in Bristol
value.description: Avon and Somerset Police officers attended a concern for welfare call in Blaise Walk, in Sea Mills, on Sunday at around 12.40am.

value.name: LORD AUSTIN: How I'm being driven out for calling Hamas 'Islamist murderers'
value.description: I was shocked to learn on Friday that I had been suspended after a campaign organised by political opponents, extremists and an online mob driven by woke ideology.

value.name: 'I will call Keir at 10.01 on election night to make sure the North gets what it deserves'
value.description: Today, as he looks forward to Keir Starmer achieving a similar election triumph for Labour, Steve is the Liverpool Metro Mayor and has power and influence – which he intends to use. He says: “We’re trying to schedule a call in to Keir for one minute ...

value.name: Sunak warned against ‘playing footsie’ with Farage and Reform UK
value.description: Rishi Sunak has been warned against “playing footsie” with Reform UK following two bruising by-election defeats. The Prime Minister has been urged by some in his party to shift further to the right to see off the threat of the Nigel Farage-linked party.

value.name: Rochdale by-election is referendum on Gaza, says Muslim charity boss
value.description: George Galloway, former Labour MP and the Workers Party of Britain candidate for Rochdale, is running on a pro-Palestine ticket Credit: PA/James Speakman The Rochdale by-election is a “referendum on Gaza”, the boss of a Muslim youth organisation has said.

value.name: Labour vows to fully ban fox hunting
value.description: Labour has vowed to eliminate fox hunting within its first term as the party insists it is moving on from a “self-satisfied urban mindset” to win over rural voters, after new polls show that the majority of voters in the countryside support a ban on the sport.

value.name: Alastair Campbell: ‘I felt like I didn’t really belong’ at Cambridge
value.description: Political strategist Alastair Campbell has revealed that he felt “out of place” and suffered from anxiety during his time at Cambridge.

value.name: SPORTS AGENDA: Man United may have to share Dan Ashworth, disgraced Labour candidate causes Burnley a headache... while Danny Drinkwater kicks off a row with his neighbours
value.description: The former FA director of elite development is set to join the Ineos revolution as sporting director in the coming days, although there will be a period of gardening leave.

value.description: In the Air Tonight

value.name: Rochdale by-election is referendum on Gaza, says Muslim charity boss
value.description: Mohammed Shafiq, CEO of the Ramadhan Foundation, says issue of Palestine will be ‘really powerful’ in the contest

value.name: Starmer calls for ‘ceasefire that lasts’ in Gaza
value.description: For months now domestic politics have been unable to escape Gaza, especially when it comes to the issue of a ceasefire. But the language has evolved. Sir Keir Starmer is now calling for a “ceasefire that lasts” and must “happen now”.

value.name: Tory Party under Boris Johnson could regain votes of ‘lost Conservatives’
value.description: Among the “lost Conservatives”, who said they won’t vote Tory at the next election but don’t know who to vote for, 52 per cent said they would vote for Mr Johnson over Sir Keir. This is compared to 39 per cent saying they would vote for the current Prime Minister over the Labour leader.

value.name: Pollster John Curtice predicts 'trouble' for Labour within months of getting keys to No10
value.description: A renowned political scientist predicts that Labour will be “in trouble” within a year and a half of forming the next Government if they win the general election. Sir Keir Starmer is widely predicted to be entering No10 following the next general ...

value.name: Labour would sanction more Russians on Navalny ‘list’ of Putin henchmen
value.description: "The cruel death of Alexey Navalny at the hands of Putin’s corrupt system must finally motivate action," David Lammy tells i

value.name: Home Office ‘turning blind eye’ to exploitation in Scottish farms
value.description: And the Home Office has been accused of “turning a blind eye” to the issue by the SNP for not releasing or compiling Scotland-specific data – from how many workers on the visa are in Scotland to where they work – which the party called “unacceptable”.

value.name: Labour moves to protect ‘special relationship’ after Starmer swipe at Trump
value.description: Labour has pledged to work with “whomever is in the White House ” following the next US Presidential election after Sir Keir Starmer took a veiled swipe at Donald Trump.

value.name: ‘We shouldn’t be punished’, drivers cry as cash-strapped council charges £50 to park outside their own homes

value.name: Tories think they've spotted a Labour weakness - and are scouring for opportunities
value.description: The Conservative campaign is seeking Labour candidates' comments about Israel and Gaza following the suspension of two MP-hopefuls last week after their comments about the Middle East.

value.name: Why I don’t buy Sarwar’s conversion to tax cutting
value.description: Voters don’t follow the ins and outs of fiscal policy, let alone the shifts and turns of election promises, though. And why should they? Much of it is hogwash and spin. People have enough on their minds managing their ever-shrinking family budgets.

value.name: War or peace: decison-time for Starmer
value.description: DECISION-TIME looms for Sir Keir Starmer as Scottish Labour united at the weekend to call for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza.

value.name: Post Office scandal: Kemi Badenoch hits back at Henry Staunton
value.description: The government says it "utterly refutes" claims by the Post Office's former chairman that he was ordered to delay compensation payments to victims in the Horizon scandal. Henry Staunton told the Sunday Times he was given instructions to "stall" payments ahead of the election.

value.name: Labour eyes UK-EU security ‘pact’ amid fresh concerns over Trump return
value.description: Starmer sets out ‘unshakeable commitment’ to Nato amid concerns over impact of ex-president’s return to White House

value.name: Starmer: Gaza ceasefire 'must happen now'
value.description: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer has called for a "ceasefire that lasts" in the Israel-Gaza conflict, during a speech at the Scottish Labour conference in Glasgow. His remarks come a day after the conference passed a motion calling for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza.

value.description: SCOTTISH LABOUR delegates rejected a motion calling for single-sex spaces at its Glasgow conference yesterday.

value.name: Labour seeking SNP deal to avoid new Gaza ceasefire rebellion
value.description: Party hopes for compromise wording after previous SNP motion saw 56 MPs defy Keir Starmer Labour is hoping to defuse a fresh crisis over Keir Starmer’s cautious stance on Gaza by rewording a Scottish National party motion calling for an immediate ceasefire.
